Like the old dragon before him, Tucson faces his enemy with a stern stance =
and brave expression upon his face.  His eyes sharply ahead and lit with a =
bright ice blue, as he vents his nostrills to remove some of the heat withi=
n his body, as a cooling method.  Steam billows out from the nostrills, coo=
ling his temperature readilly.  He gives light only to give him enough to s=
ee his path, yet not enough to see deeper into the darkness.  His tail cont=
inues to twitch as his eyes narrow further.

" Tell your master the feeling=
 is mutual.  I'm looking forward to meeting him myself. "

He says quietly =
yet in a tone of sarcasm.  He lifts his head somewhat to balance his body a=
 bit more propertly.  

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supe=
rcyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson treads carefully down the =
slope and realizes that he needs to grip
> > the ground with his talons.  S=
o with thick claws he does just that, using
> > his tail for balance.  He t=
hought of using it to swat away the weapons that
> > were so annoyingly pla=
ced around him but his judgement told him otherwise.
> >
> > There would be=
 a good possibility that he might have to tangle with an enemy
> > more pow=
erful then himself.  Yet he was prepared to do anything for the sake
> > of=
 preservation.
> >
> > " Old dragon, could this be why you have guided me h=
ere?  This used to be
> > your kingdom and now you hope that I will continu=
e your legacy?  I hope I
> > can do that old friend, I hope I can."
> 
> <N=
EW>
> 
> There is no immediate answer to TUCSON's question as he was led by=

> GUILEDART, HARDHEAD and HYDRA down through brush and foliage and
> acros=
s one path and to the next.
> 
> Finally they reach the clearing that held =
the strange energy door and
> stepped through, and immidiately they were al=
l plunged into darkness!
> 
> The ground beneath TUSCON's feet changed as h=
e stepped through. On one
> side there was dirt and soil mixed with leaves =
and discarded branches.
> On the other side there was the hard and unyieldi=
ng feel of cold
> metal, there was a scratching noise made as TUSCON's nail=
s raked
> across it as he attempted to keep the same grip he had outside.
>=
 
> As they walked overhead lights began to flicker on and TUSCOn could
> s=
ee that he was in a hallway, also made of metal, it had the feel of
> the i=
nterior of a ship or perhaps a base.
> 
> They came to a single large door =
that looked thick enough to stop
> grimlock and full rage! In front of it a=
 single Predacon was standing
> and he turned to look at GUILDART as he app=
roached. "My my." He said,
> a hiss in his voice. "What have we got here?"
=
> 
> GUILEDART came to a stop, "It is . . . good to see you Rapticon." He
>=
 said as he bowed his head slightly in greeting. "It is a gift for
> Magmat=
ron." He said looking at him warilly.
> 
> Behind him HARDHEAD and HYDRA ke=
pt their weapons trained on TUSCON,
> but there was a definite fear of this=
 creature in front of them as
> well.
> 
> RAPTICON looked nearly identicle=
 to the transmetaled DINOBOT that
> MEGATRON had made near the end of the f=
irst Beastwars. He looked like
> an armored skeletal version with bladed cl=
aws, sharp teeth and a
> glowing mechanical optic that replaced on of his m=
ore organic looking
> ones.
> 
> "He does look tasty." RAPTICON said as he =
smiled at TUSCON. "But I do
> believe that Magmatron will want the pleasure=
 of dealing with him
> himself."
> 
> GUIULEDART nodded, "As I would have s=
urmized."
> 
> RAPTICON gestured at the door as he looked at TUSCON, "Magma=
tron bids
> you welcome." Although his words might seem cordial, the tone a=
nd
> manner from RAPTICON was anything but!. Instead there was his manner
>=
 was that of spider inviting a fly into a web.
> 
> He chuckled as he stepp=
ed aside and the door began to iris open,
> almost like teeth in some great=
 maw opening.
> 
> NEXT POST: MAGMATRON
